20-1017.summary: Recommendation to receive and file notice of adjournment of the September 8, 2020 regular meeting of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, California.Page 1 of 3TELECONFERENCE, 4:30 PMTUESDAY, OCTOBER 13, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTESA motion was made by Vice Chair Pearce, seconded by Commissioner Price, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 11 - Zendejas, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Andrews, Uranga, Austin, Hudson, Tanzer, Pearce and Richardson2.

20-1013.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, California Regular Meeting held Tuesday, August 11, 2020.A motion was made by Vice Chair Pearce, seconded by Commissioner Zendejas, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 11 - Zendejas, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Andrews, Uranga, Austin, Hudson, Tanzer, Pearce and Richardson3.

20-1014.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Housing Authority Financial and Operational Performance Reports for June 2020.  (Citywide)A motion was made by Commissioner Zendejas, seconded by Commissioner Mungo, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Zendejas, Supernaw, Mungo, Andrews, Uranga, Austin, Hudson, Tanzer, Pearce and RichardsonAbsent: 1 - Price4.

20-1015.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Housing Authority Financial and Operational Performance Reports for July 2020.  (Citywide)A motion was made by Commissioner Zendejas, seconded by Commissioner Mungo, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Zendejas, Supernaw, Mungo, Andrews, Uranga, Austin, Hudson, Tanzer, Pearce and RichardsonPage 2 of 3TELECONFERENCE, 4:30 PMTUESDAY, OCTOBER 13, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTESAbsent: 1 - Price5.

20-1016.summary: Recommendation to authorize Housing Authority, or designee, to execute all documents necessary to amend Contract No. 34756 with BDO USA, LLP, formerly Casterline Associates, P.C., of Philadelphia, for professional accounting services, to increase the contract amount by $50,000, for a revised total contract amount not to exceed $411,378, and extend the term to December 31, 2020.  (Citywide)A motion was made by Commissioner Zendejas, seconded by Vice Chair Pearce, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 11 - Zendejas, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Andrews, Uranga, Austin, Hudson, Tanzer, Pearce and Richardson6.
